intro: Erlangea vernonioides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has a compact, bushy appearance with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers bloom in spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
